Review:
oof, that was an experience. I kinda loved it tho

I went into this knowing the kind of hate this movie, Snyder and the DCEU in general are getting, and you know, after Man of Steel I ‚Äûkinda‚Äú understood it. Man of Steel was an interchangeable, Michael Bay-esque city destruction movie where nothing had any real consequences. Needless to say, I was extremely positively surprised to see that Snyder went on to address all that in the sequel.
Batman vs Superman is good. I actually happen to love this take on Batman, a bit rugged and rough on the edges, but still believes in his own moral superiority. I think it‚Äôs a logical evolution from the the previous versions we‚Äôve seen on screen without loosing the core of the character. And I also happen to love the dilemma of how a god-like being like Superman could possibly fit into a human society. Where the movie falls short a bit, in my opinion, is how it concludes those storylines. The infamous ‚ÄûMartha‚Äú scene wasn‚Äôt the best decision, granted, but apart from that part I think the movie does a pretty good job. I was genuinely invested in the characters in the end, something that I cannot say about Man of Steel. This was a huge step up and I believe this movie deserves more love than it‚Äôs getting.

Beides ist hier ja zweifellos erf√ºllt. ‚ÄûDer Soldat Monika‚Äú ist eine Doku die ihren Zuschauer*innen vertraut, das gesehene weitestgehend selbst einordnen zu k√∂nnen, indem sie bewusst nur selten bis gar nicht Aussagen versucht zu kontextualisieren. Um ehrlich zu sein kann ich mir nicht vorstellen, dass ein Film √ºber Monika Donner anders √ºberhaupt funktionieren k√∂nnte, ohne dadurch etwas an seiner Komplexit√§t einzub√º√üen. Der Film schafft es sehr gut, die Person Monika Donner mit allen ihren Facetten darzustellen, und gleichzeitig die vermeintliche Diskrepanz in ihrem Weltbild aufzul√∂sen bzw dessen etwas n√§her zu kommen. Gleichzeitig ist es auch nicht immer leicht zu schaun wenn mit dem T-Slur um sich geworfen wird oder der Holocaust f√ºr extrem unpassende Vergleiche relativiert wird. Am Ende ist es eben ein Film √ºber durchschnittliche Gespr√§che zwischen durchschnittlichen √ñsterreichern. Inszeniert wird das ganze in einer wilden Mischung von echt aufgenommen Szenen, Interviews, nachgespielte Szenen ihres Lebens, Animationseinlagen, abstrakte Kampfszenen, und (grandiose) Musik-Performances von der Band ‚ÄûGewalt‚Äú. Es ist eine Doku wie sie keine andere ist, und irgendwie funktioniert es.¬† Wor√ºber ich mir aber noch unklar bin ist, was und ob es aus diesem Film etwas was √ºber eine Charakterdarstellung Monika Donners hinaus geht mitzunehmen gibt. Ich tendiere zu eher nein. english version: I like documentaries about interesting people, and I generally like films that take an unconventional or bold approach to their genre. Both are undoubtedly fulfilled here. "Der Soldat Monika" is a documentary that trusts its viewers to be able to classify what they see for themselves as far as possible by deliberately making little to no attempt to contextualise statements. To be honest, I can't imagine that a film about Monika Donner could work any other way without losing some of its complexity. The film manages very well to portray Monika Donner as a person with all her facets and at the same time to resolve the supposed discrepancy in her world view or to get a little closer to it. At the same time, it is not always easy to watch when the T-slur is thrown around or the Holocaust is relativised for extremely inappropriate comparisons. In the end, it is a film about average conversations between average Austrians. The whole thing is staged in a wild mixture of real recorded scenes, interviews, re-enacted scenes of her life, animated interludes, abstract fight scenes and (amazing) music performances by the band "Gewalt". It's a documentary like no other, and somehow it works.¬† But what I'm still unclear about is what and if there is anything to take away from this film beyond a character portrayal of Monika Donner. I tend to think no.
